intro: Ervatamia yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan ervatamia, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan province. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
